title: Was Mordekaiser born with that name, or did he adopt it?
body:
I just thought about something.

Morde was a kid once, right? That means that his parent(s) saw him and said, "Aww! What a cute baby! Let's name him *fucking **Murder Emperor!"*** (that's the literal meaning of Mordekaiser)

replies.body:
If I wanted my kid to be feared across the world, I would name them that as well.

In my headcanon, I believe that Noxus is actually Mordekaiser's true first/last name. The reason that they would want to name the nation that is to remember his defeat and whatnot.
I think that might be because of the Noxii tribes who founded it, after they killed him...
Does Noxii, Noxus, anything with Nox translate into anything?

Possibly. In Latin, "nox" directly translates to "night" (Noxus already has Roman inspirations; see the Trifarix, for instance).

Mordekaiser's mace is named "Nightfall"; Noxus is similarly named.

Keep in mind that the german language likely does not exist in the lore of league of legends,so "mordekaiser" does not necessarily translate to anything within the world of runeterra.

And Mordekaiser might be his last name,not his first one.
"Yes, my name is Gregory Mordekaiser - M, O, R, D... Yes, yes, just like it sounds. No, A-I. It's German. I know, I know..."

.> Sees a Riot post in a Mordekaiser Lore thread.
.> Epxects useful infos.
.> Gets random joke that is still good enough.

>
> "Yes, my name is Gregory Mordekaiser - M, O, R, D... Yes, yes, just like it sounds. No, A-I. It's German. I know, I know..."

Canon?
Canon.

I'd assume it's a either a title or a nickname he got from back when he was a warlord.

His original name has probably been lost to the ages after his resurrection on the Shadow Isles.
im fine with this headcanon. seems realistic to me.

Murder Emperor. Is the direct translation.

Seems like something a peasant would call a Tyrant with a reputation for murder.
I want to say "No" but this is a universe where Gangplank's name is straight up just "Gangplank" and some cruel parents named their son "Tobias Foxtrot".  So, I mean...I don't think we know for sure.
Tobias is a nice name IMO. At least it sounds good to me as someone lives in a place Tobias is never a name of a person. Maybe people are biased against this name in NA for a reason I don't know.

Tobias is fine, I was more goofing about someone named "Tobias Foxtrot" making their new name "Twisted Fate".  Like "I can keep the initials, but I want it to be _COOLER_."

(There is a popular sitcom character named Tobias over here that might be influencing my judgement, though.)

tfw ritos post in Morde lore topic but give no Morde lore

{{sticker:sg-janna}}
Well, we now know what his first name is

> [{quoted}](name=ZackTheWaffleMan,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=AiZgx6jU,comment-id=000a0000,timestamp=2018-07-31T16:34:13.260+0000)
>
> Well, we now know what his first name is

I think that was more of a joke than his real name
I'm accepting it as canon until another Rioter says otherwise
I like to think that in the game world Mordekaiser doesn't translate to death lord or whatever, and that it is his real name

Okay, it's triggering me more than it should, but everyone keeps getting it wrong.
Mordekaiser does NOT mean Death Lord, but is more literally translated to Murder Emperor.
Which is miles cooler than that edgy joke of a name.

*insert Heavy Metal REEEEE here*

"Aww! What a cute baby! Let's name him fucking Murder Emperor!" 
I think he might be related to Bakugo from My Hero Academia....
https://pm1.narvii.com/6480/8027caf95a9b218db3bc647069e253e1dc70ccd5_hq.jpg
I mean, my name is Mordekai (it's a Jewish name) and I'm from Israel, it's a completely normal name here (Mordekaiser is Jewish confirmed).

Just like Mufasa and Scar (from the Lion King). Their asshole dad Ahadi named his first son Mufasa, which means "King." Then he named his second son Taka which means "Trash". Not only that, after Taka gets gouged in the fucking eye by a buffalo, Ahadi declares that his second son should be called "Scar" to constantly remind him of the incident.
“Ja, ich bin Mordekaiser.  Ja, Morde.  Tote.  Kaiser.  Nicht ein spiel.”
Pretty sure mordekaiser means "death king" or "dead king" so uhhhhhhhh probably a title
Pretty sure he adopted it. Adopting a cool title is one of the first things lich's usually do after conquering death.

Well, Sauron was originally called Mairon.
Seeing that he's Morde's inspiration, this theory doesn't seem unlikely.

Maybe his father or mother was an evil king with the ability of looking at the future or something... so he or she said: "This boy is destined to rule over Valoran, lets call him DeathLord" ... i mean, its possible.
